properties.name: Ah Tee Ko Ko Mee
properties.details: Sim Ah Tee, 73, is a hawker for over 50 years Being unable to read or write, Ah Tee was at a disadvantage when the Covid-19 Circuit Breaker started last year. While eateries and hawkers scrambled to offer food delivery, Ah Tee could not keep up with the new technology. “At the age of 70 plus, he’s not agile enough to multitask anymore. He’s still using the old Nokia handphone,” his son Calvin Sim, 49, tells 8days.sg. It doesn’t help that Ah Tee (pictured above) also faces competition from the bigger, more well-known Berseh Food Centre nearby. Despite the slow business, he has continued to open his stall as usual. “He’s a committed person. He’s making a loss every day, but insisted on carrying on till now despite using his own savings [to sustain]. As I’m working, I can’t manage his calls for him,” says Calvin, who tried to help his dad drum up business by posting about the stall on Facebook foodie groups like Can Eat! Hawker Food.

properties.name: 85 乡村古早蚝煎
properties.address: #01-05, 85 Fengshan Centre, Blk 85 Bedok North St 4, 460085
properties.details: Like Ah Tee, hawker Goh Peng Huan, 61, struggles with dismal numbers. Together with his partner Anne Tan, 59, he runs the 85 乡村古早蚝煎 stall at Fengshan Centre in Bedok selling fried oyster omelette, carrot cake, bak chor mee and handmade ngoh hiang till 11pm daily.  From February to June last year, they had zero income as their hawker centre was undergoing renovations, which were delayed by the pandemic. When Phase 2 (HA) kicked in on May 14, 2021, there was immediately a “drastic drop” in business. Speaking to 8days.sg, Peng Huan’s daughter Desrina Goh, 39, says: “There was a 60 per cent drop in customers. Today was the worst yet, not even 30 per cent of the usual number of customers.” Delivery is also out of the question for Peng Huan. “My dad is illiterate, so it’s very difficult for him to work with a digital delivery platform. WhatsApp orders are not possible as well, because he can’t read,” Desrina frets.

properties.name: Yong Tau Foo (酿豆腐)
properties.details: Helping a friend who is badly affected by the Phase 2 Heightened Alert. They are neither on delivery platforms nor knows about Hawkers united until recently. This unassuming couple are up 3am every day, preparing fresh Yong Tau Foo for sale. They serve yummy versions such as the Dry (sweet sauce), Soupy and Laksa. Look at the variety and you know it is a hit with the elderly – who loves items such as brinjal, lady-finger, yam, pork belly, intestines and so forth. Their Laksa is very very old-school-authentic, too! Serene insisted to serve value for money Yong Tau Foo in the Macpherson community for the past 7 years. She refused to raise price even as supplies do get more expensive over the years. Always courteous, Steven serves his wok-hei Char Kway Teow at the back of the stall as supplement as the elderly loves it. The one and only Yong Tau Foo stall in this market. Pls support if you are in the area! P/S: Serene’s parents used to own this famous Yong Tau Foo stall in Kallang Airport for the past 30 years – 40 years and they decided to retire and pass down the family recipe!

properties.name: Liang Chuan Fishball Minced Meat Noodle (#01-37)
properties.details: A humble stall serving up the most delicious fishball or mushroom minced meat noodles from just $3 in the heart of Clementi. The mushroom and meatballs are fresh and juicy, and go well with the noodles which sit in a bit of gravy – just the way I feel it should be. Stall is owned by a couple who’ve been running this stall for decades now. Had a chat with the owners recently and they mentioned that business is awfully bad during this period, particularly dinner time. Sadly, they’re also not on any food delivery platforms. Hence, I told them I’d do my best to help spread the word on social media. A very tasty meal at an affordable price. Order a bigger portion if you prefer.

properties.name: Fried Kuay Teaw Mee
properties.details: Elderly couple who doesn't know how to use delivery app or other platforms. do visit them and render your support! They work until very late just to sell enough plates of food.

properties.name: Authentic mushroom minced meat fishball noodle
properties.details: I am a regular at this stall at Block 431 Clementi Avenue 3 selling minced meat fishball noodles (bak chor mee) and also laksa.  I went to da bao lunch just now and the elderly uncle and auntie who run the stall said business has been quiet since the new dine-in restrictions kicked in. They have recently joined Grab Food - “108 Minced Meat Fishball Noodles” but no orders so far �� Their bak chor mee and laksa are both good - please support them if you can! (FUN FACT: Uncle and Auntie used to be avid ballroom dancers and once made the news in a feature on talented hawkers ��������)

properties.name: Fresh Fish Soup
properties.details: Last week I did my 1st live in Golden Mile Hawker Center with my Dylan Tan bro. While chatting with this fish soup uncle and look around his stall. I saw all his fish are so fresh and he work everyday. Even these bad days for him, he is still operating just wanna serve his best food to all. Uncle know about Hawkers United - Dabao 2020 but he doesn't know how to post, ask if I can help him to post. Of course I'm most willing to help uncle.  You can call uncle at 90062894 to order, uncle can bring it to the roadside for you as we understand there's always Q at car park entrance. Uncle will onboard gradfood soon too.

properties.name: Roasted Delights
properties.details: Please support this pair of brothers who operate a roast meat and kway chap stall in the kopitiam located at 118 Hougang Ave 1, Singapore 530118.  Their roasted meats are tasty and sio bak is delightfully crispy. I have been a long time patron of this stall and found their kway chap to be well prepared with generous portions. The brothers are quite senior and does not have any online ordering. They are completely reliant on take away orders. Unfortunately, as with all hawkers, they are struggling and shared that they are currently operating at a loss. Every packet counts and your gesture goes a long way. So if you are in the area, please visit this stall. Thank you.

properties.name: Mai Ji Xiao Pai Dang
properties.details: They are not on any delivery platforms, owned by two uncles. I hardly see any crowd and they are always the only stall left opened in the evening.  Their fried rice and sweet & sour fish are one of the nicest I’ve ever had! If u happened to be around this area, pls drop by and try it out.

properties.name: 养生汤 - Traditional Herbal Claypot Soup
properties.address: 531A Upper Cross Street #01-52 Hong Lim Complex 051531
properties.details: Uncle Chua believes in there’s no replacement for cooking herbal soups in a claypot over a charcoal fire, and he’s one of the few hawkers who still does diligently everyday. He starts preparations at 5am to make sure the herbs and ingredients have enough time on the stove, bringing a nostalgic, home-cooked quality to the nourishing soups. Though he gets less customers these days, he still puts his heart into cooking and making sure the flavours are still the same.

properties.name: 潮州海鲜鱼片汤肉骨茶（Teochew Seafood/ Sliced Fish Soup and Bak Ku Teh)
properties.address: SkyTech Food Court, 200 Bukit Batok Street 23, #09-18 659543
properties.details: The stall is run by an older uncle who finds it challenging to provide delivery. Despite adding new dishes like Bak Ku Teh into his menu over the years, uncle kept his old signboard and made do by hand-writng "Bak Ku Teh" onto his signboard. This is a hidden food place that many who stay in Bukit Batok don't know about so do support the stall if you can!

properties.name: Golden Mile Teochew Fishball Noodle
properties.address: 505 Beach Road, Golden Mile Food Centre #B1-47 199583
properties.details: This humble store specialises in traditional Teochew style fishball noodle and has been at Golden Mile for decades. I love that they serve a little of everything and offers food variety of ingredients including prawn, fish ball, pork ball, fish cake, sliced pork and even char siew which diffentiate themself from the typical fishball noodles. Texture of the meepok dry is good and the sauce is just nice and taste heavenly when mixed together. No alkaline taste and noodles remained springy even after dabao all the way to Pasir Ris. Do offer your support to this hawker which is currently not on any delivery platform nor social media. If you are looking for a good bowl of noodles, do give it a try. So satisfying!

properties.name: 鱼圆肉挫面 (Fishball and Minced Meat Noodle)
properties.details: If you are around Dunman Food Centre, do try this elderly aunty’s fishball noodle and minced meat noodle. She’s in her 60s and has no online or social media platform. Her stall is at the basement along the same row as the popular wanton noodle and tau kwa pok stalls. The noodles are quite nice, and aunty is always generous with the ingredients and portions. She is a very pleasant elderly. She prepares her noodles with lots of care and love. She does not have speed so if you are ordering more portions do give her more time. Her portions are really value for money. Please try and purchase from her as she does not have many customers.
properties.contributor: May Goh and Hock Kee Tan

properties.name: 朋友 Friend
properties.address: 59 New Upper Changi Rd, #01-1248, 59 Food Court 461059
properties.hours: daily 6am-7pm (may close slightly earlier depending on the day's situation)
properties.details: Aunty told me that as compared to last year's CB, her business has been more badly affected this time round. Please Support her! Aunty works 12 hours a day, and only took 2 rest days a month before COVID. Please if you live nearby, do drop by and order some kolo mee. She fries her own pork lard and makes her own chilli. It’s super yummy! No delivery as it’s just her handling everything. The uncle in the same shop space sells very delicious hokkien mee too. Please support them!

properties.name: 肥阿嬷迷你锅  (Fat Ah Ma Mini Pot)
properties.address: Golden Mile Food centre 505 Beach Rd #01-89 199583
properties.details: My original intent this evening was to sample a pasta meal from Chef Choo Signature (Stall B1-45) but I arrived too late, just as they were closing. As I walked around to look for an alternative option, Uncle & Auntie eating their dinner outside their quiet stall looked up expectantly at me. I took a quick glance and two items immediately caught my eye - 卤猪脚Braised Pig Trotters and 麻油鸡 Sesame Oil Chicken.  Uncle happily obliged my sinful request for fattier parts of the pig trotters and also gave me a good-sized serving of chicken. Auntie tempted me with a spoonful of her special 家乡猪肚汤 Pig Stomach Soup which was peppery, the way I like it. I will definitely return to try that and also the 肉骨茶 Bak Kut Teh / Pork Rib Soup & 干炒老鼠粉Stir Fried Mee Tai Mak �� As I was leaving, the couple expressed their heartfelt gratitude for my patronage. It wasn’t much but I guess it meant a lot to them ��

properties.name: Da Jia Shi
properties.recommendations: Cantonese style congee. several options available. deep friend intestines (signature item). fried beehoon/noodles
properties.details: My grandma and recently, my mom too, has been running this Cantonese style congee stall in Chinatown Food Complex since 1960.  Since then, they have been relying on weekend regular customers and the lunch crowd from the CBD areas however with COVID-19 and especially the work from home arrangement coupled with the  no dining in restrictions, the business have been heavily impacted, like with most stalls there.   Given the location, there are not many residential places within the area unlike the heartlands hence delivery platforms aren't a viable alternative.  They are just a humble congee stall that just wants to provide comfort food for everyone and would be great to get some support during these tough times!

At 1pm they still had a lot of noodles left unsold, especially on rainy days.  https://www.misstamchiak.com/wan-li-xing-wanton-mee/

properties.recommendations: Carrot cake, Hokkien mee, char kway teow, Orh luak
properties.details: Two elderly uncles run the stall and are not on any online or delivery platforms. Stall was very quiet on a weekday afternoon. Also only accept cash payment. I love their black carrot cake!

properties.name: Shuang Sheng Fishball Minced Meat Noodle
properties.address: Blk 58 New Upper Changi Road #01-170 Spore 461058
properties.details: Elderly stall, operate long hours as customer reduce by 50%

properties.name: Sanho Foods
properties.recommendations: yam cake, chee cheong fan, economic bee hoon, kopi, tea and more
properties.details: Stall has been there over 10 years, serving mostly elderly customers.

properties.name: Fried Kuay Teow
properties.details: Elderly uncle runs this stall alone and he seems be having difficulty walking. Stall Location is in the heart of CBD hence relying on working lunch crowd which is sorely absent now. Business isn’t as bustling as other stalls during the times when I’m there.

properties.name: Matasoh Self-Made Fishballs, Meatballs and Minced Meat Noodles
properties.details: Uncle makes fishballs as early as 4am but business affected during the night.

properties.name: 32 Roasted Delights
properties.recommendations: Dang gui duck, wanton noodles, roasted delights
properties.details: Started the stall 3 weeks before HA. Due to the location of the stall is within industrial area, many of the employees are working from home and nearby housing estate is quite far away, the orders of the food are greatly affected. More than 60% drop. Even with the grabfood service putting in place, there is no order so far.

properties.name: 163 Ikan Bakar BBQ
properties.details: My parents are in their mid sixties and they are not IT savvy. This pandemic is causing them to suffer a loss in their business and furthermore,  they are not engaging any delivery companies (Grab, Foodpanda etc.).

properties.name: 平平粿汁猪什汤 (Ping Ping Kway Chap and Pig's Organ Soup)
properties.details: The stall is not on any delivery platforms. Please help them if possible

properties.name: Eu Kee Eleven Finger Scissors Cut Curry Rice
properties.details: Stall owner set up delivery via app but because of WFH, there is no office crowd to buy from him, especially in that area where the restaurants have an upper hand with delivery accessibility. Also, there’s literally no gains from using the app for delivery, and there’s no one else to do delivery too.

properties.name: 華記香港烤鴨皇 Hua Ji Hong Kong Roasted Duck King
properties.details: This stall is managed by once of the most humble husband and wife I have ever met. That fact that their situated at an industrial area meant that they are even more handicapped in times of Phase II. They would gladly appreciate the help and support provided for them in times like this. Do not worry about the food being unauthentic, owner once lived in Hong Kong and managed to picked up skills pertaining to roasted delights and bringing traditional charcoaled flavours to our shores.

properties.name: Poy Kee Yong Tau Foo
properties.details: Owner is above 70 years old. Have been in business for 40 years.

properties.name: Kwek Seng Huat Eating House
properties.recommendations: Chicken/duck rice, Kolo mee, Prawn mee, Fried Kway Teow, Cai png, zi char, malay food
properties.details: Elderly owners who are not digitally savy. Putting this down so that residents in Amchorvale area have another place to tabao as well!

properties.name: Guang Dong Porridge
properties.details: My Mom has been struggling with business since the first circuit breaker. She doesn’t want to get delivery options because this hawker is moving to another place at the end of the year. She doesn’t own this stall and has to pay a much higher rental fee than other hawker stalls. She has to work everyday (takes 1 day break twice a week only so she can earn more money)  With the no dine-in rule, and everyone staying at home, the business dipped greatly. I hope that this platform will be able to help my mom to improve the business. Thank you !

properties.name: Chun Kee Fishball Noodle
properties.details: Together with a lot of stall holders in the same hawker, they lost quite a bit of the working crowd so let's do what we can to help them

properties.name: Nan Heng Hainanese Boneless Chicken Rice
properties.details: Together with a lot of stall holders in the same hawker, they lost quite a bit of the working crowd so let's do what we can to help them

properties.name: 632 Fried Kway Teow

properties.details: Elderly hawkers manned by husband and wife, does not have any helper

properties.name: Kway chap and pig organ shop
properties.details: 2 elderly hawker, serve cheap and nice kway chap. No plathform for delivery and impact their business

properties.name: Qin Dine Health Soup
properties.address: 8 Somapah Road, Level 2 Food Court, S'pore 487372
properties.recommendations: Chinese health soup, chinese cold meat and vegetable dishes (like saliva chicken 口水鸡, smashed cucumber salad and liang ban dou gan), rice
properties.details: Due to WFH situation, business has dropped drastically due to office workers in the vicinity working from home, students learning from home, and being located in a business park.

properties.name: Jalan Benaan Kapal Food Centre
properties.recommendations: Charcoal toasted bread and eggs. Porridge. Chicken rice. Cai Png.
properties.details: This Food Centre is not under NEA but under SLA and do not qualify for the grants that NEA hawkers get. Some are elderly like Ah Hoe who sells Kopi O for 60 cents. And the porridge stall who's a young chap selling porridge for a living.

properties.name: Wan Zai claypot
properties.details: This 1 month business have drop a lot so kindly help

properties.name: Hock Kee Bak Kut Teh
properties.address: #01-34, Alexandra Village Food Centre, 120 Bukit Merah Lane 1, Singapore 150120 150120
properties.details: A stall run by a 70-year-old uncle. The uncle is very kind and humble and passionate about his hokkien style claypot bak kut teh. He is 2gen of the stall and he learned the cooking method from his dad since 1960s.

properties.name: Jin Bao Claypot Rice
properties.recommendations: Claypot Chicken Rice, Claypot Yam Rice, Sesame Chicken , Herbal Chicken,  Pig Trotter,  Preserved Vegetable With Braised Meat
properties.details: Elderly Hawker

properties.name: Fried Carrot Cake
properties.hours: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday Friday, Saturday - 5pm - 9pm Wednesday and Sunday - Closed
properties.details: Decided to go visit my all time favourite Carrot Cake stall today at Albert Centre near Bugis Street. Went by at around 6pm but there were only a few people at there. The carrot cake was soft and savoury. Really really generous portions of carrot cake and eggs! I personally prefer black carrot cake over white carrot cake, the sauce is not too sweet which won’t make you feel jelak !  Price: $3/$4/$5 Phase 2 HA really affected lots of our kind and hardworking hawkers. Please tabao from them if you’re nearby or have time to go down it’s really good!

properties.name: Uncle Yeo Lor Mee
properties.details: Uncle Yeo lor mee, the prata and economical beehoon were once known as the 3 dragons ...however during this period, the number of customers going to them dwindled down significantly...

properties.name: Tiong Bahru Braised Duck
properties.hours: 7am - 3pm, closed only Tuesdays (during CB period) and closed only Sundays (when dine is in available)
properties.details: Hi everyone, if you are ever in the Tiong Bahru area please check out my parents’ shop and dapao some food! They have been in Tiong Bahru market since before I was born (the stall has been there for more than half a century, from one-level wet market to the current building, both the stall and recipe are passed down from through generations and the stall will end with my parents' retirement unfortunately. My parents are elderly in their early 70s and I am currently not in Singapore to help them out. They can barely read English nor use smartphones efficiently and the stall is not registered on popular food delivery platforms. My parents are able to take bulk order via their phone 9650 4614, however please be understanding if they are unable to pick up the phone as it is only the 2 of them and they may be serving customers. THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR THE SUPPORT AND WARMTH!!

properties.name: Prawn House
properties.details: $3 Prawn noodles with soup that packs a punch �� Usually quite long queue during lunch and dinner time but not a single person in front of me today. Auntie also told me business took a hit cause no office crowd

properties.name: Wei Nan Wang Hock Kian Lor Mee
properties.address: 5 Cross St, #01-46, Market Street, Interim Food Centre 48424
properties.details: Uncle and aunty has been selling this for many years since golden shoe carpark days.  Lunch time but the usually overcrowded HC felt like a ghost town. There was no queue at this stall at all, I was the only customer at the time ��. Uncle and aunty lamented that biz is really down without the office crowd. Usually by this time, their noodles and ingredients will run out but I still saw so much left on the shelf.  I got the $4 portion as I don’t know when I’ll be here again next. The specialty of this stall is the big pieces of crispies and happy that they separated them so I saved to eat them last

properties.name: Hwee Kee
properties.details: Elderly couple

properties.name: 335 Hong Kong Roasted Meat
properties.details: Auntie is very sweet. Sadly, like all other hawkers her business has been affected... she reduced the price of her chicken to try and attract more customers. So sharing this yummy chicken with you all and hope you will enjoy it as much as I did.

properties.name: Hui Wei Hokkien Mee
properties.details: Stall is run by an elderly man whose sales has dropped drastically for him, forcing him to close on certain days to keep expenditure costs low

properties.name: Vend Solution
properties.recommendations: Curry Chicken and Fried Bee Hoon
properties.details: This hawker stall is situated inside a petrol station (Cynergy), hence only people who work nearby will know about the place. Most of the people who work at the stall are the elderly so they do not know how to operate on grab. Their food is good and affordable, portions are really generous. Would love to have them on the map so people would know more about the place.

properties.name: Nian Nian Fa Dimsum
properties.hours: 5:30am to 3pm but Dimsum usually sells out around lunchtime.
properties.details: Run by a middle aged HK couple, now Singaporeans, who settled down in SG 30+ years ago. Language and technology being a barrier, they are unable to go online to take orders for their dimsum, steamed rice dishes and soups.

properties.name: 3 Sisters Prawn Noodle
properties.address: 162 Ang Mo Kio Ave 4 #01-06 Mayflower Market and Food Centre 560162
properties.details: The 3 sisters hawkers are not digitally savvy

properties.name: Yuan Lang Soy Sauce Chicken Master
properties.address: 335 Smith St, #02-041 (yellow zone), Chinatown Complex Food Centre 050335
properties.details: Not on delivery platforms like whyq, business is suffering. Their food is not bad, just not as well-known compared to other soya sauce chicken stalls. Uncle is pretty friendly!

properties.name: Hock Sin Kee Tze Char
properties.address: 120 Bukit Merah Lane 1, #01-02 (Alexandra Village Food Centre) 150120
properties.hours: 11 am till 9 pm everyday except their off-day on Tuesday
properties.recommendations: Ginger/onion chicken, sweet and sour fish (either fish slices or whole fish), hokkien mee and omelette
properties.details: Value-for-money tze char dishes. Operated by 2 elderly relatives around their 70s with their diehard spirit in the physically demanding hawker trade. The stall doesn't have delivery service and rely on regulars. Serves great ginger/onion chicken, sweet and sour fish (either fish slices or whole fish), hokkien mee and omelette at reasonable prices. Accommodating and willing to customize your dish according to your requirements.

properties.name: Ah Liang Ipoh Hor Fun
properties.address: #01-35, Market Street Interim Hawker Centre, 5 Cross Street 048418
properties.recommendations: Fried fish dumpling horfun, seafood horfun. The herbal sauce horfun is smooth and tasty, perfect with green chilli. Fried fish dumplings are crisp and filling is very bouncy & qq.
properties.details: Elderly hawkers, lowered footfall because they are located at CBD area. Their fish dumplings and horfun is very nice, when CBD crowd was still present there would be super long queues. They put in a lot of effort and it shows, the food is good!

properties.name: Zhi Sheng Cooked Food
properties.address: #02-108 Amoy Street Food Centre, 7 Maxwell Road 069111
properties.hours: Not too sure, but online it writes 11am - 2.30pm. I think it's open only from Mon - Fri.
properties.details: Elderly hawkers run the stall. Their caifan is not bad, homely and comforting taste plus it's super cheap. $2.50 for 1 meat 2 veg with rice, super good value. They're on whyq also but no CBD crowd so less business.

properties.name: Soon Lee Lor Mee Stall
properties.details: Elderly hawker, No delivery platform

properties.name: Chwee Kueh
properties.address: #02-67 Taman Jurong Market & Food Centre, 3 Yung Sheng Rd 618499
properties.details: https://www.8days.sg/eatanddrink/81-year-old-hawker-sells-chwee-kueh-at-taman-jurong-from-6am-13843494

properties.name: NEWTON BIG PRAWN NOODLES (Branch)
properties.address: Soon Soon Lai Eating House, 32 Defu Lane 10  539213
properties.hours: Monday to Saturday: 0730 - 1600 , alternated Sunday: 0730 - noon
properties.details: Soon Soon Lai Eating House is located in a industrial area, their main customer are the workers who works in the companies in the industrial area. Due to the pandemic situation most people have been working from home. The stall owner does not uses delivery platform and thus, their business have been seriously affected.

properties.name: He Ji Hokkien Fried Prawn Noodles
properties.details: Elderly hawker, food is good!!!

properties.name: Mymumcharsiew Wanton Noodles Stall
properties.details: Located in industrial area, not easily accessible. Business hit by covid but wanton mee is very nice. She marinate all the pork and charsiew herself and it is delicious. Hope many will get to know her wanton mee. Her health is not good but she desire to work hard for the family and let many eat her delicious noodles

properties.name: O Kee Fishball Noodles
properties.address: #01-138 Boon Lay Place Food Village, 221B Boon Lay Place 642221
properties.recommendations: Dry mee pok noodle and fishball soup
properties.details: The stall is run by an couple in their mid 80s, who has been selling fishball noodles since the 1960s. They are struggling with the business amidst P2HA, only managing to sell 1 or 2 bowls every few hours.

properties.name: Jasmine Pork Rib Noodles
properties.recommendations: Pork Rib Noodles are the best
properties.details: They have amazing food and opened by a pair of sisters for over 10 years. They have to support both families through these tough times but yet they don’t complain and continue to serve customers with a bright smile.

properties.name: Jiu Hi Porridge (九记粥品）
properties.recommendations: Their porridge is smooth and "gup". Very home cooked, comfort food that you would expect from your grandma. Good for something flavourful yet light. If you want meat, order their pork porridge that comes with juicy meatballs. Don't forget to add an egg and spring onions!
properties.details: Very old school Cantonese Porridge that has been operating in this hawker centre for many years. Hawkers are an elderly couple who do not have any delivery services and rely on old regulars and the working crowd to survive. With WFH they are struggling but still maintain a positive attitude. Uncle likes to joke in a mixture of Chinese and English.

properties.name: No. 1 Maxwell Restaurant
properties.recommendations: Fish soup is flavourful. You can never go wrong with fried rice!
properties.details: Called No.1 Restaurant because they are literally #01-01 in Maxwell food centre. Despite having the word restaurant in the stall name, they charge really cheap prices for a CBD hawker store. Uncle cooks an extremely wide range of dishes, from wanton mee to fried rice to fish soup. Despite this, all are surprisingly tasty! Uncle does not have delivery capabilities and is facing difficulties due to the lack of working crowd during this WFH period.

properties.name: Ah Zheng Ban Mian and Sliced Fish Soup
properties.address: 84 Marine Parade Central, 84 Marine Parade Central Market and Food Centre, Singapore 440084 440084
properties.details: Sells good fish soup!

properties.name: Soon Huat
properties.details: Elderly Hawker & he is not tech savvy. Lor Mee comes with some tasty crispy fried side dish (not really sure what it is). Many other hawkers in the area too who seem to be not tech savvy and do not have much people patronizing the area.

properties.name: This stall doesnt have a name
properties.recommendations: Hokkien mee! Very tasty and the chilli is power
properties.details: Eldery uncle only has hokkien mee on his menu.

properties.name: Keat Hong Economic Rice
properties.address: Blk 253 Choa Chu Kang Ave 2 #01-05 Singapore 680253 680253
properties.recommendations: Great food with cheap price and the owner super friendly
properties.details: Business badly hit by Covid

properties.name: Keat Hong Curry Rice
properties.recommendations: Great Food and super friendly owner
properties.details: Business badly affect due to no office crowd

properties.name: Fu Zhen Seafood Restaurant
properties.details: Stall is around for an estimate of 10+ years

properties.name: Hong Li Mei Wei Xiao Chi (鸿利美味小吃)
properties.address: #01-17 Holland Village Food Centre, 1 Lorong Mambong 277700
properties.details: Not sure how long this uncle has been around, but ever since I grew up here (>20 years), he has been cooking and selling his delicious food here. His stall doesn't look super attractive initially but I reassure you, it's delicious. The horfun, beehoon, mee goreng, fried veg w rice all has plenty of wokhey and is very very very affordable for Holland V (price ranges from $3-5). Pls help him out because I really think his food deserve a chance to continue to impress everyone like myself :-)

properties.name: Da Shi Dai Ban Mian 大食代板面
properties.hours: Wednesday        7am–5pm Thursday        7am–7:30pm Friday        7am–7:30pm Saturday        7am–5pm Sunday        7am–7:30pm Monday        7am–7:30pm Tuesday        7am–7:30pm
properties.recommendations: Ban Mian, Mee Hoon Kuay, You Mian
properties.details: One of the BEST banmian in Singapore, trust me on this (and I have indeed tried plenty of banmian). The noodles are all handmade and the BROTH IS SO GOOD. Minced pork and pork slices are so tender and fresh! But the best part of the stall is the chilli, it really packs a punch! I've been eating from this stall since I was in primary school and up till now in my mid 20s... An elderly uncle runs this stall and they aren't available on any delivery platforms. The uncle can help you to separate the noodles from the broth so your banmian will remain al dente even when you dabao home :-)

properties.name: 37 Cooked Food
properties.details: Was at 210 lor 8 hc yesterday.  Rather quiet.  Some stalls has 2-3 waiting in line, but many elderly hawkers were just sitting around, waiting �� made a round and settled for ccf. The lady asked if I want to separate the sauce,  and said "你打算几点吃，下了酱放久了，不好吃...". This is the gen of hawkers who put their hearts in their food.  I added 2 more soon kueh and she didn't charge extra for separating the sauce.  How much profit can she be making? If she goes to delivery platforms, how much do we have (r we willing)to pay for 2 ccf+2sk? These are the people I hope to help,  and if you are nearby, do give them your support. BTW, she may not be carrying the full list of items for this period, so I just buy what she has.

properties.name: Xing Li Cooked Food
properties.details: I never failed to patronise this old uncle stall whenever I go Old Airport Road Hawker Centre. This stall is selling one of the best Fried Oyster Omelette I ate before. Went to this stall today and can tell that business is baldly affected for this uncle stall.  No food delivery options for him due to his age. It’s really a pity if I don’t share this good food around. Uncle fried order by order and always generous with his portion of the oysters. Do hope that business will pick up for him , whoever is around that hawker, do look out for this stall and try his oyster omelette. Definitely no regrets

properties.name: Tow Kwar Pop
properties.details: He's been selling barbecue rojak since 1965, below image with his hawker push cart.  Do try it out, If you are a rojak fan!  He claimed this year heightened phase 2 is worse than last year locked down. Quite a significant impact to his business.  He continued to retain his stall assistant without any pay cut. But couldn't gave any pay raise either, so he reduced working hours instead.  He remained humble, down to earth and positive. (For those who know him, you guys shld know)  Do help to support if you are near and convenient! ����

properties.name: 没问题
properties.address: 118 Depot Lane, Yue Hua Coffee Shop 310210
properties.recommendations: This stall sells Bak Chor Mee, with special interest in 鱼香 (I believe it refers to fish paste ngoh hiang). Most of the items are priced between $3 - $4 (excluding container). A duo of elderly uncle and auntie runs the stall. 1230PM today, the usual lunch crowd is absent. I took away a laksa bee tai mak (Laksa老鼠粉). The bowl contains 2 pieces of 鱼香, 2 pieces of Taupok, 3 prawns, a good handful of fishcake and bean sprouts. The serving size almost hit the container cover. + Great broth. I randomly dig a spoonful and look at the amount of dried shrimps I caught. + Bee Tai Mak is my favourite way to enjoy Laksa. I recommend preparing your own big soup spoon (those ramen type is the best) to scoop generously. + Fish ngoh hiang has a good texture and is not overly salty. + Fish cake is "crunchy". + Everything served piping hot despite business not brisk - Prawn is not the best, no cockles (I don't eat cockles, so I don't care) - Not on delivery platform (Please support at physical stall) Hundred people will have hundred favourite stall for a particular dish. For me, I ask myself,  Did I enjoy this bowl? Yes. Will I recommend? Yes This bowl of laksa will not make you cry, but will definitely make you sweat. I do believe I will be going back to try other items on their menu. The first impression has been good.

properties.name: Ho Kee Fried Rice
properties.address: #01-31, 6 Jalan Bukit Merah, ABC BrickWorKs Market and Food Center  150006
properties.details: Decided to patronize auntie as she has no buisness. There is only 1 google review thus far.  Hubby is impressed and wrote her a 4 Star ⭐️ review. Hubby is v critical about his favorite fried rice and actually bothered to write a review to support auntie. It must be good and worthy.  Please SUPPORT our humble hawker who is working hard to make a living.

properties.name: Ping Fu Yong Tau Fu
properties.details: Everyday I see them coming in to shop hoping for people to buy their YTF.  Everyday they're here because they want to serve their customer.  They were saddened by the Phase2H because they are not on any platforms. They were like 小弟，30%我们赚什么❓ Yes that's the hard truth. I hope people can see through their lens and also tech company profiting heavily through food.  No need to cook yet making a profit. Such success is what we always dreamt to be but in reality, it hurts big time for F&B.  Please stop making passive income through tech by tapping on F&B anymore....

properties.name: Katong Jago Char Kway Teow
properties.recommendations: Char kway teow with extra chilli
properties.details: Middle aged guy running the stall single handedly

properties.name: Niu Ji Prawn Noodles
properties.address: Pasar 16 @ Bedok. Blk 16 Bedok South Road 460016
properties.details: Middle aged siblings 3 running the stall. Prawn noodle soup (dry version available; just ask. Along with usual variety of noodles to choose from; beehoon, yellow sek mee, kway teow) in the mornings, fried hokkien prawn mee in the evenings topped with generous portions of fragrant chilli and pork lard.

properties.name: Teochew Kway Chap
properties.address: #02-117 AMOY STREET FOOD CENTRE 7 MAXWELL ROAD 069111
properties.details: Elderly Uncle, he mentioned his business is quite effected compared to others as his dishes are typically bought by people eating there as a group. As a takeaway solo dishes are opted for hence his is not high on the list for takeaways.

properties.name: Ya Kun Prawn Noodles
properties.details: Elderly hawker, not on any delivery platform.

properties.name: Claypot Bak Kut Teh and Char Siew Wantan Noodle
properties.details: They are an elderly couple. Don't seem to me like they are having a good flow of customers. Also they don't have an online platform.

properties.name: Soon Kee Duck Rice Eating House
properties.recommendations: Duck rice and their assorted sides!
properties.details: Very old school shop with little to no digital advancement. Located at a ulu area where people dont really pass by. Food is very nice just that it is inaccessible and business can be improved with this initiative!

properties.name: Shi Wei Xian Noodles House 食为先面家
properties.hours: Open from Monday to Saturday. Closed on Sunday and PH
properties.details: This stall has existed since 1984. The stall owners are 2 elderly folks who have worked tirelessly for more than 37 years. This stall was originally located at Taman Jurong (next to the Indian cinema). Due to redevelopment in the area, the stall owners had to relocate to a few other places and eventually settled for the current location. The old place was popular with many Malaysian workers during that period.   They used to sell a large variety of noodles like Curry Chicken Noodles, Shredded Chicken Noodles and Soy Sauce Chicken. However, due to their old age they could no longer afford to offer so many dishes. Fortunately, they have kept their signature Wanton Noodles, and have added popular noodle choices of Minced Pork Noodles and Laksa to their menu for the younger generation. These 3 noodles have also become their best seller at their current location.  Stall owner are still working till date because they need to earn a living for their daily expenses.   So, please do help them out when you are around the area!

properties.name: Cheng Ji Chao Xia Mian Hao Jian
properties.address: Seah Im Food Centre, 2 Seah Im Road, #01-59 99114
properties.details: Weather not hot liao went Seah Imm see see look look. Many stalls closed. All long queue. This Hokkien Mee stall no long queue. Wa kao eh. $4 this much. Auntie Uncle see me friendly and they are very warm with their hospitality. 4 prawns.  I told auntie I want big one. Big packet how much. She ask want $3.00 or $4.00. Lai la auntie. $4.00.  Chatted with them abit. Auntie Uncle, you sell this price can make ah? Nowadays ingredients not cheap you know. Ya Ah Di, Uncle no cannon you. These prawns $14/kg. Uncle Auntie retire liao. Children grow up. Stay at home boring. Come out work as hobby nia. Uncle Auntie have many regulars buy from us a decade and a half liao. I don't want disappoint them by raising the prices.  Felt so blessed. Even the buffalo size me can't finish.

properties.name: Hakka Noodles
properties.details: One of my favorite stalls in Holland Drive. Always with queue but no crowd now. Auntie said business is really bad with no dine in.  Love love love Hakka NTF (in fact everything Hakka!) but had to avoid It for the past couple of months due to an unfortunate incident!  Enjoyed the noodles and NTF so much this morning!

properties.name: Ah Yan Putian Food
properties.details: Normally when ppl talk about cck 787 ppl talk about the famous Loh Mee here but I like to share this hidden gem store at 787 call Ah Yan Putian Food. As I was walking my dog that day and happened to walk pass the food court I saw the auntie just sitting there somehow I decided to park my dog outside and just go in to buy my dinner from her.  I can see the sparkle in her eyes when she saw I was walking toward her shop I not sure I'm the number what customer for today but I did feel she is really happy. Highly recommend the pig stomach soup this soup is not the traditional peppery kind of soup but yet there is a natural sweetness in the soup which really impress me and auntie is very generous with the pork stomach. �� This shop dun have any food delivery platform as well, I hope this post can help auntie a little bit.  Also if you take a look in the shop you will see is extremely clean as compare with other shop.

properties.name: Chang Ji Gourmet
properties.address: Chinatown Complex Food Centre, 335 #02-110, Smith St 050335
properties.details: Walked around the entire food centre, deciding what to tapao. Queues were forming at the popular ones like Hawker Chan, Xiu Ji Ikan Bilis YTF, Pan Ji Sak Kei Ma, etc. At the same time, there were many stalls with slow business, especially those located at the hidden or fringe locations. Found this old school porridge & fried beehoon stall, only 3 items on offer: beehoon, mee and porridge. Tapao porridge and beehoon, at $1.20 each, plus $0.20 for container.  Verdict: Wow! Flavourful beehoon, simply fried with bean sprout. Old school flavour, not mushy. We found the sambal chili was an unnecessary distraction. Could have done without it. Porridge was simple plain one with soft peanuts. Loaded with umami from 柴鱼! We love the smooth texture. Both times were really well made. Surprise find. Must eat!

properties.name: Holland V. Fried Beehoon
properties.address: #01-11 Holland Village Food Centre, 1 Lorong Mambong 277700
properties.recommendations: The shop is a simple economy beehoon stall. Fairly standard add-ons but their beehoon is fantastic because it is less oily than normal stalls.
properties.details: Run by a couple who don't seem to know how to use food delivery platforms .

properties.name: Ampang Niang Tou Fu
properties.hours: Closed on Wednesdays. Open all other days from 1130am - 830pm
properties.recommendations: Their crispy fried Tau Kee, handmade fish balls (super bouncy) and eggplant is super good (stuffed with meat). Their clear soup is really the best thing to dip all your YTF pieces in.
properties.details: Been around for the longest time along east coast road. Staple in the area and I’ve been eating their ytf for years.   Been struggling during this heightened alert and post circuit breaker. Delivery options are not really an option because mark ups are too high as they’re scared of scaring away customers. They said if their business carries on this way, they won’t be able to to sustain keeping their store open.   Please support! It would be quite sad to see them have to pack up shop.

properties.name: RI Eng Noodle House 日恩面家
properties.address: 498 Jurong West St 41, Chang Cheng Coffeeshop  640498
properties.details: One of the better BCM with No Queue. No Social Media, No Delivery, Not even on Google Map. Please do support when if the queue at the next stall are so long. Their BCM is really damn good!

properties.name: Lun Kee Fried Carrot Cake
properties.details: Green zone of Chinatown complex... help help... nice couple... started their biz more than a month, didn't expect HA to happen..

properties.name: Teochew Kway Chap, Pig's Trotter Rice
properties.address: 1 Jln Kukoh, Jalan Kukoh Food Center 161001
properties.hours: Opening hours 10AM to 7PM. Close on Sunday.
properties.details: Located at Jalan Kukoh Food Centre, this kway chup has also suffered huge reduction in income. Besides kway chup, there are also hor fun, fried rice, hokkien mee, etc. Uncle is very friendly and chatty so do pay him a visit.  Note that Jalan Kukoh Food Centre rely mainly on customers from outside the neighbourhood, so its especially hard during these period. Hope we can go that extra mile.

properties.name: Mei Ji Xiao Pai Dang
properties.details: Hi guys! This zichar stall is located at a very ulu industrial area, 8A Admiralty Street, Food xchange building. Near 财神庙, opposite of Sembawang camp!  They are not on any delivery platforms, owned by two uncles. I hardly see any crowd and they are always the only stall left opened in the evening.  Their fried rice and sweet & sour fish are one of the nicest I’ve ever had! If u happened to be around this area, pls drop by and try it out.  Thank you

properties.name: 51 Old Airport Road Char Kway Teow
properties.address: 51 Old Airport Rd, Old Airport Road Food Centre  390051
properties.hours: Opening hours: 10am - 9pm Closing days: He said depends, mostly Tues or Wednesday
properties.recommendations: Old school style, do ask for less sweetness and buay Pai taste
properties.details: Old Airport Road. I am just a customer. Do patronise uncle's stall. There are 3 elderly who are helping one another.  He was feeling under the weather as there are snaking queues everywhere. When I decided to purchase, you can see the happiness and gratefulness in his eyes. Shortly after that, a customer decided to buy as there is a customer who is queuing. "Uncle, I help you broadcast in Facebook." "I am illiterate and don't know anything about social media." There is sadness and helplessness  in his eyes.

properties.name: A1 Handmade Ban Mian
properties.details: Hello Everyone! It’s been quite a while since I last posted here, but dining in is still further pushed back to 21st of June, which is affecting all of the F&B businesses. I am posting on behalf of this uncle’s humble stall. His business have been even more heavily affected due to all of these measures that are in place ever since the start of circuit breaker. He is not tech-savvy, thus I wish to reach out to the community to support his business.

properties.name: San Xi Hainanese Chicken Rice
properties.address: #01-53 BENDEMEER MARKET AND FOOD CENTRE, 29 Bendemeer Rd 330029
properties.details: Introducing a good chicken rice stall in north east region- san xi hainese chicken rice. Both poach and roast chicken are equally good ; tender and full flavour. The rice are hand fried with all classic Hainanese conditment before cooking and their chilli sauce is bomb and hot like hell and tangy. The chicken organs like liver and innards are fresh and doesn’t have the foul smell. They sell roast pork too which I have yet to try. You can pack soup away for extra cost of 30cts for takeaways but before covid is free to take and is kinda of soup ur mom will make comprise of chicken feet’s and stuff.  Stall has no delivery mode and they opened early from 9am onwards till finished every day.  Do visit them when you are in boon Keng  I been eating them consecutively for more than 10 times and meat is consistent. They don’t have delivery mode and pay them a visit instead on the spot to support them. I will said this is a hidden gem while they have their own fan base as well.

properties.name: Porridge (粥)
properties.details: A gem hidden in a less popular neighbourhood of Singapore, Geylang East Food Centre. I chanced upon it last Wednesday when I was there dabao-ing for the family.  Saw an old uncle (stall owner) sitting in his stall waiting for customers. Obviously, his stall didn’t catch the attention of many patrons. But I decided to jump in to try. Weather was afterall hot and I don’t have much appetite to eat something that it’s too heavy. Looking at the long list in the menu, I ordered a prawn cheong fan @ $2.50 with 6 prawns in it and a bowl of cuttlefish and pork porridge for $2.50. I watched every skilful step he took to make that one roll of cheong fan for me. From laying the flour mixture and steaming it to adding the ingredients, all made with love. Items are mostly priced $2.50/$3.  Was surprised how soft the chee cheong fan was (just like those that I tried at Chinese restaurants) and it went perfectly well with the savoury hk style black sauce. Congee was smooth with abundant slices of pork and cuttlefish.  I know I will go back to that stall again. And here I am, at Geylang East Food Centre (Stall # 01-26) to dabao lunch for the family. This time round I remembered to whip out my camera to take some insta-worthy photos and share it with you all.  Enjoy all!

properties.name: Yong Huat Cooked Food Stall
properties.address: 210 Lor 8 Toa Payoh #01-66, Toa Payoh Lor 8 Market 310210
properties.details: Shui kueh is 砵仔糕 in Cantonese, recalled seeing vendors steaming the kueh in mini clay bowls when growing up in Chinatown. Have been buying from this shui kueh uncle for more than 20 years.  He used to be very chatty and loved to joke when his partner was around.  Haven't seen the elderly lady for some years and uncle seems to be more quiet.   Missed the time when he jokingly teased me on my 书包 (a backpack I used to carry).  What I really love about his stall, 1) he makes the shui kueh himself,  2) he is still steaming the kueh in old school metal container,  not disposable plastic. Usually,  there is a reasonable Q to keep him busy.  Recent weeks, noticed that he is less busy.  Maybe shui kueh is not a main course... sadden to see him sitting quietly by his stall.  Whenever I see that, just want to keep him busy, to motivate him.  When patronizing the hawker center,  hope you can get some snacks from him.

properties.name: Famous Beo Crescent Hokkien Sotong Mee
properties.details: Today I finally managed to re-live my Poly days craving of the famous Beo Crescent wok hei FHM that has since moved to Alexandra Village, Blk 127 Bukit Merah Lane 1 coffeeshop! Hope this post can help the stall to rally some support as there was no long queue and business seems quiet at 130pm on a weekday.

properties.name: Jin Hai Cooked Food
properties.details: Was at Amoy Street Food Centre to check out more food from our elderly hawkers. If you are around the area, do check them out.  #01-40 - Jin Hai Cooked Food. Uncle only offers 2 types of food: Hor Fun and Fried Rice. for $4, you get a pretty good plate of fried rice with wok hei and there are lup cheong, eggs and prawns. Definitely has that old school taste.

properties.name: Xiang Chang Coffee Shop
properties.details: Was at Amoy Street Food Centre to check out more food from our elderly hawkers. If you are around the area, do check them out.  #01-51 - Just opposite Jin Hai Cooked Food is Xiang Chang Coffee Shop. It is run by an friendly elderly auntie. Her teh peng is not overly sweet and the milk doesn’t overpower the fragrant of the tea. Worth a try!

properties.name: Tai Sun Coffee
properties.details: Was at Amoy Street Food Centre to check out more food from our elderly hawkers. If you are around the area, do check them out.  #02-121 - Where can you find drinks under $1 in the CBD district? Come to Tai Sun Coffee. Their soya bean drink, barley and Chin Chow is 80cents for small (which is the normal size) and $1 for the big cup. Grab a drink and support uncle!

properties.name: Fishball Noodle
properties.address: 260 Ang Mo Kio Street 21, Canopy Coffee Club 560260
properties.details: Was wondering where is Blk 260 Ang Mo Kio as a member recommended spicy Hor fun. Went there at 11.10am, not opened yet for this Tze char stall. Other Stalls no body buying so change of mind bought one from fishball stall... Prawn noodles $5.00- nice and big prawns. Disadvantage for this Coffeeshop- too deep in from main road.  Those with transport maybe can help these stalls out.

properties.name: Sin Heng Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice. Char Siew Roasted Meat and Roast Duck Rice
properties.details: Please help to support my parents' stall if you happen to be nearby. I went to find them yesterday and the whole hawker centre is so quiet. They have been coming home late which breaks my heart...

properties.name: Ah Tai Hainanese Chicken Rice
properties.details: Hey guys! Let’s help this uncle out! I was chatting with him and he told me he used to be the chef at tian tian chicken rice before he decided to leave and open up his own stall a couple stalls down from tian tian only! while tian tian had a line his stall barely had anyone patronizing! let’s all support this uncle pls! He previously tried to do food panda/ deliveroo but the orders kept getting cancelled as he was unable to understand the platforms.
properties.contributor: Joan Alessandra Chen and Eric Chng

properties.name: Xiang Xiang Hainanese Chicken Rice
properties.address: Amoy Street Food Centre, 7 Maxwell Rd, #01-02 069111
properties.details: Hi everyone! I’m just a customer and a Hainanese too! While searching for lunch at Amoy Street Food Ctr, i went ahead to buy my colleague’s lunch: Chicken Rice. When i stepped into the food ctr on lvl 1 and laid eyes on the 1st row of food stalls, i spied Xiang Xiang Hainanese Chicken Rice! The auntie offers authentic ginger sauce!! It’s a must to have with Hainanese Chicken Rice! Besides the usually fare of white or roasted chicken, organs and braised egg, she’ve got chap chye & hainanese styled fried egg!! And besides the usual cucumber, she adds bits of fresh tomatos and lettuces! Do support her (she’s in her 80’s) as her husband(90’s) slipped and fell 3 months ago and is in a bad condition. From the brief conversation and my understanding, her husband’s insurance have been fully claimed and now every month $5k is being deducted from her. She’s does everything on her own and struggles. If u r in the area, pls do go down to her stall and support her! Thank u!

properties.name: Bedok Centre Grill
properties.details: I am just a customer who forgot to ask working hours and resting days. (*shall ask next round) If you just want solid taste of Char Shao and Shao Rou, this is the stall. I have been a regular customer. Really Buay Pai and affordable. He sells assorted variety of cooked meat and I usually buy Char Shao and Shao Rou. There are other kinds so you can go and see see look look.  I just went and bought both type and started to take a picture of his stall.  "Uncle, I help you to broadcast on Facebook, ok?"  I have never seen him and his elderly father  smile so broadly. (in a mask)  Again, they are the people who fell through the cracks who don't know how to use social media.  If you live near by, do patronise his stall. Ps : His customer service is good!!

properties.name: Chuan Soon Heng Cooked Food
properties.details: Helping stall auntie to spread the words. There is not much human traffic at the other end of the hawker center, so the biz volumn is very low, some days she may only transact less than $10/-.  If you pass by, just take a look, see if there is anything that you  may want to try. Thanks. ���� Together, united and stay strong.

properties.name: Heng Heng Fish Soup 興興鱼湯
properties.address: 21 Bukit Batok Central Bukit Batok CC inside Food Paradise 659959
properties.recommendations: Fish Soup, Fish Porridge, Vinegar Pig Trotter
properties.details: Business very badly hit after dine-in bans

properties.name: Lily's Wok
properties.details: Please support auntie lily at amoy street!  She used to be at lau pa sat selling fish soup before moving to amoy to sell mixed veg rice. Only breakfast is served now, due to dwindling business and auntie doesnt want to leave food over long periods and eventually go to waste.. Similar to other hawkers, she is not on any delivery channels.  Her Belacan Chilli is tops! (For spicy Chilli lovers) And home made glutinous rice served on mon, weds, Fri and sat! Every little bit of support we can give will help during this period.. Thank you!

properties.name: Putien Traditional Cuisine
properties.details: Please support this tze char stall located at St Michael's bus terminal~The stall owners can only understand Mandarin. It just opened and HA happened): The wok hei really is gao gao and the portion is very generous! Do request for lesser salt if you've got sensitive taste buds like mine. The lychee pork (sweet and sour pork) is pure meat, almost no flour! Just a satisfied client! The food and dishes taste very homely

properties.name: Local Delights
properties.details: At the Hawker Centre this morning and many stalls were closed. Saw this stall managed by an old couple with no queue. In fact, I passed by them few times and realised they barely have any customers. They sell bee Hoon and mutton soup. They are not on delivery platforms nor using any electronic payment methods. Taste wise, it’s just like any home cooked meal. A bit salty but that’s nothing compared to their hard work and enduring the wait to have someone come by to buy from them. If by bearing with the saltiness can trade happiness for them, I am more than willing to do so. If you come this hawker, try to support them.

properties.name: Yao Heng Cooked Food
properties.details: Yesterday I went all to the west to Boon Lay Hawker Center and immediately this satay bee hoon stall caught my attention. An aging uncle self prepared at the stall, without any platform being used as uncle is none tech savvy.  Our 1st gen hawkers like uncle showing us the real attitude of a pioneer hawker. Doesn't matter if business is poor, doesn't matter if it's pandemic but as long as they able to open their stall for business they will only do their best and served the best food for us. Hope friends  can support this stall, support thus uncle.

properties.name: Tian Tian Porridge
properties.address: Chinatown Complex Market & Food Centre Blk 335 Smith Street #02-185 050335
properties.hours: Daily except Monday, from 7 am till sold out
properties.details: This stall is a family owned business with a history of more than 60 years. Before Chinatown Complex was built in 1975, the stall was near an alley. While everyone was sleeping, the chef would arrive as early as 1am to prepare ingredients for the day. Generous amount of meat or fish at affordable price. The porridge is rather creamy. Due to Covid-19, their business have been affected greatly as they have not been using any delivery apps as they are not tech savvy.

properties.name: Seremban Beef Noodles
properties.details: Came to this relatively new looking coffee shop to dabao at Blk 929, Tampines Street 91.  No queue. Order took a while as I can see that the aunties and uncle there are trying to familiarise themselves with the workflow, orientation of the stall and the new machine for payment/orders.  No photos of the dabao-ed food as my old folks immediately attacked once I reach home. Tasty and flavoursome.  Definitely can eat!

properties.name: Blue Star Fried Hokkien Mee
properties.address: Hougang Hainanese Village Centre, 104 Hougang Ave 1 530104
properties.details: I like Blue Star. This stall is run by a nice elderly couple and they are not on any delivery platforms.

properties.name: Oyster Omelette
properties.details: Henry from Newton Food Centre is finding it hard to survive. He has 2 school-going kids and no other sources of income.

properties.name: Khin Kee Fish Ball Kway Teow
properties.address: 01-06, Havelock Cooked Food Centre, 22A Havelock Road 161022
properties.details: This stall not on delivery platform, the uncle working alone just now when I patronize this stall. This photo is before dine in not allowed. Their minced pork is sold out, so only handmade fish ball with noodles S$3. Quite a decent bowl of fishball noodles.

properties.name: Everyday Tea Stall 天天茶室
properties.address: AMK Ave 10, Cheng San Food Centre, Everyday Tea Stall, 天天茶室 #01-128 560527
properties.hours: Open 5.30am - 1030am Tues - Thu, Sat & Sun until 11.30am. Rest days Mon & Fri.
properties.details: Stall has been operating since the 1979s. 50 years of fragrant hand-brewed traditional coffee and tea from $0.80/cup – The owner insists on keeping prices low (they were planning to +$0.10/cup in June but Covid hit and he decided not to) due to the owner’s belief that “[they] have seen 3 generation of customers from grandfathers to their grandchildren, and keeping prices low is a way of repaying the favour to our loyal customers. As long as they like the coffee, [he will] continue to brew it”. True to his words, the price of their drinks have only risen by $0.20 over the past 12 years.

properties.name: Ah Seng (Hai Nam) Coffee
properties.details: This is one coffee stall I used to frequent on weekends and they enjoyed brisk business from CBD crowd or weekend cyclist in the past.  But due to phase 2, their business is so bad. You might wonder, how bad can it be? I went at 11am to order 4 French toast, 2 Kaya toast,5 packets of kopi and teh and 2 soft boiled eggs for about $15. They told me I’m the 2nd or 3rd customer since 6am and others only bought one or two cups of kopi. Which means they only earned probably about $20 since 6am������ Their pricing is already relatively lower than other coffee stalls so it doesn’t make sense for them to be on any delivery platform.  Please please don’t let our local coffee heritage die. That one cup of $8 latte you save today can be used here to save a local business. If you happen to be at the vicinty, please patronise this mother and son shop.

properties.name: Min Hiang
properties.address: #01-60 Bendemeer Market & Food Centre, 29 Bendemeer Rd 330029

properties.name: Wang Mei (Chin Ji) Soya Bean
properties.address: Toa Payoh Lor 8 Market, 210 lorong 8 Toa Payoh 310210

properties.name: THE JUICEMAN
properties.address: B1-79, Telok Blangah Crescent Block 11 Market and Food Centre 90011

properties.name: Dot Sugar
properties.details: Please support this pair of friendly oppa bosses who are selling bubble tea, dessert and coffee. Since the start of Phase 2 (Heightened Alert), the bosses shared that their business has dropped by 60 to 70% as the CBD area has turned into a ghost town since everyone started working from home again. The amount that they are earning these days is barely enough to cover half of the stall rent. They also shared that delivery platforms don’t help, as they charge fees that are up to 5 times the price of the drinks and desserts.

properties.name: KA Cafe
properties.hours: 6.30am-3.30pm (subject to changes in line with the current situation)
properties.details: Located in the Tai Seng Industrial area, footfall has been low since the start of Phase 2 HA as everyone is working from home and not going to the office. Despite this, the hawkers continue to take pride and prepare for people to takeaway lunch. These stalls are not on any food delivery platform as the hawkers would like to keep their food reasonably priced for their customers.

properties.name: Soya Bean Drink #01-114
properties.details: Please support this elderly uncle who is operating this drink store. Bought the soya milk and its good ����Not related to him but just hoping to help him a little as he mentioned that current business has been very poor..if you are dropping by old airport road hawker do get a drink along with your food to support and help them tide over this period ❤  #supportlocal

properties.name: Mini Snack Bar
properties.details: Stall near the carpark entrance/exit. Their food is nice. Selling a variety of food. Old Aunty is very nice and friendly. Customers are mainly from the building. Since Covid-19 started.  I think their business got worse as more employees are working from home.  Do patronize if you are in the nearby area.

properties.name: Coffee #01-108
properties.address: 505 Beach Road, Golden Mile Food Centre, #01-108, Singapore 199583
properties.details: Drink stall gotten in July 2020. Barely few months into business. The whole hawker Center was closed for renovation. Business resume sometime in March 2021. Due to heighten, business was affected. Please help to support if you are around golden mile food center. she serve cheap and nice coffee and tea.

properties.name: Lucky Sugarcane Juice
properties.address: #01-21 KAKI BUKIT 511 MARKET AND FOOD CENTRE, BLK 511 BEDOK NORTH STREET 3, 460511 460511
properties.details: This is one of the last remaining original stalls since Bedok 511 Market was built. The uncle has been selling sugar cane juice for at least 35 years. While his sugarcane juice may be slightly more expensive than Coffee stall, his quality is much better. Do buy a pack from him if you are dabaoing nearby.

properties.name: Hui Min Chinese Herbal Tea
properties.address: #02-143 Chinatown Complex Food Centre Blk 335 Smith Street 050335
properties.details: This stall has been run entirely by one elderly hawker for years. Pls support his herbal teas, which are freshly brewed!

properties.name: 茗香 Min Hiang
properties.details: Elderly Hawker

properties.name: Bismi Tea Stall
properties.address: #02-85, Amoy Street Food Centre, 7 Maxwell Road 69111
properties.details: No online presence, hard to take online as drinks are cheap. Business has suffered due to lowered footfall in CBD area. Teh Halia is pretty good. Uncle is very nice, please support!

properties.name: 129 Coffee Stall
properties.details: Super affordable kopi and breakfast sets ($2.20 for toast, eggs and drink). They’ve been keeping prices affordable for old folks in the estate but with WFH arrangement, the crowd is significantly less in the hawker centre. And most people will dabao food but not drinks.

properties.name: Hock Guan Drink Stall #01-114
properties.address: Telok Blangah Crescent Blk 11 Market and Food Centre O90011
properties.recommendations: Buying any drinks from him will be good!!
properties.details: Elderly hawker selling drinks and beverages alone... saw him sitting there for long without customers:( went to support by buying hot tea from him. I do feel he needs more support from everyone

properties.name: Balas cafe
properties.recommendations: Coconut shake and teh tarik and chendol drink!
properties.details: Hardworking couple, coming to their 60s. They run a drink stall and I saw them there for a few days with loads of drinks an none selling out. Eg coconut and sugarcane.

properties.name: Soya Bean Point
properties.details: This elderly uncle selling various flavors of desserts ! I doubt he is using any platform for extra orders to flow in…  His bird nest drink is only at $1.10/-  Very refreshing & tasty ! Do drop by and support him if you are around the area.

properties.name: The 1950's Coffee “五十年代”
properties.details: Ever wondered what is it like for a famous Hawker Centre in town area? I checked out the MAXWELL Food Centre on a Sunday and many hardworking stall owners were there diligently opened their stalls and waiting for business during this difficult period of Phase 2 (Heightened Alert) where dine-in is not allowed. Please show your support to them! A small gesture of visit to buy anything from them, helps! Thank you.

properties.name: Sin Seng Juices Corner
properties.address: 590 Upper Thomson Rd, Sembawang Hills Food Centre 574419
properties.hours: Opens daily at night between 9.30pm to 12 midnight.
properties.details: Please support the fruit juice stall uncle as his business as taken a severe hit due to the curbs on dine-in.  Fruit juice are made on the spot and are never dilluted. He will suggest different fruit juice combinations if you ask. He has all kinds of fruits available to choose from. Also popular are his cut fruit platters and jelly slices.

properties.name: Korean Cuisine
properties.hours: Mon to Fri 11am to 6:30pm Sat 11am to 4pm

properties.name: Signs A Taste Of Vietnam Pho
Bali Nice
properties.hours: daily 5pm-12am. Closed on Tues unless public holiday

properties.name: Meng Fruits
properties.address: Block 4A Jalan Batu Market & Hawker Centre #01-32 432004
properties.details: I decided to venture into Jln Batu Hawker Centre. As I was walking around, I noticed this lone figure sitting quietly staring at his mobile phone inside his stall. In my 5 minutes of observation, I noticed maybe 15 folks walked past his stall. Not a single one of them approach his stall. I decided to walk up to his stall.  When Uncle saw me approaching him, he eagerly stand up and asked what I would like to have. I can sense his urgency but when he said, I am his 1st customer of the day. My heart sank deeply at that moment.  The time then was 1145am, politely I asked if his sales takings were affected by the recent prohibition of dining in. He gave out a loud sigh.. I can sense his helplessness then and there. Jokingly he said "人算不如天算" (unpredictable situation). "Its a very tough situation". He relies on regulars and walk in customers. Now that it is the by default mode to WFH, his regulars don't come that frequently anymore. And walk in customers who can't dine in, are not buying drinks from him that much. Also, Jln Batu Hawker Centre can be a bit ulu to some.  Regardless of the situation, Uncle still maintain his positive outlook. With a sense of pride, he strongly recommended to me his 100% handmade agar agar jelly dessert. He said his agar agar is probably the cheapest or if not, one of the cheapest that one can ever locate in Singapore. At 0.50cents a piece of the agar agar jelly, they come in various flavours. Coffee, Yam, Rainbow, plain and few others - really Can Eat for me. This is the best part - Uncle refused to increase his price over the years. He said his customers included mostly senior citizens and those who are staying around the area are in 1, 2 and 3 rooms flat. Affordability is an issue to some of the folks there. Uncle said he could not bear to increase his pricing and would rather earn lesser or none at times. Even when he is struggling to stay afloat, he still has a compassion heart for others. For this, he has my utmost respect. What surprises me was that Uncle is also selling his agar agar jelly in a big square plastic container box at only $4 - see picture. I got 3 boxes of Yam agar agar jelly without hesitation. Uncle was very appreciative and hope that I will come back soon to try his yakult fruit juices. He is also selling slice cut fruits too.  Folks, this is one genuine Hawker whose business is greatly affected by the present situation. He has a big heart and filled with compassion. He deserve all your support, so please go down to support him and share this post for greater awareness. Whether its a slice of cut fruit or a piece of agar agar jelly at 0.50 cents or a cup of fruit juice, it matters alot to him.

properties.name: Malay stall
properties.details: Copied from FB post:  Hi all, I'm a taxi driver.  Everyday morning 4.15am, I will pick up a Malay aunty  from teck whye to blk 136 potong pasir ave 1.  This Malay aunty selling Malay foods at blk 136 potong pasir. She in her late 60s with walking difficulty . Walking with a walking stick.  Due to this covid-19, her business is badly affected. She is old traditional style .Don trust food delivery like grabfood or foodpanda.  I pick her up daily since 2018 till now. Due to covid19, her business hit badly. Sometime she have to owe my taxi fare accumulated near $100+.  Knowing government giving subsidy for rental but the coffeeshop owner does not give them the rebate. Despite going to MP several time but still no action taken.  She have a soft and kind heart. Always help those who she can help like, In potong pasir neighborhood, there a guy in his mid 40s with some mental issue, without failed, she will try to give him $2 and food few time almost everyday.  Everyday during the journey, I will try to ask how her business the day before. Sometime she will say , business is quite bad till she can't pay her daily rental $50 etc.  Her leftover food, she will try not to throw away. Sometime her balance kuey / curry puff she will ask someone to pass to the mosque.  Sometime , she owe my taxi fare near $100+ , she will need to wait for her monthly CPF retirement fund to come in to pay me.  Hope, people who nearby or staying at potong pasir will support her food.  She sell Malay food like nasi lemak, mee Siam , Mee goreng , Mee rebus , Mee Soto and many more.  Her location is at blk 136 potong pasir coffeeshop ( Just infront of carpark gantry)  Her opening timing : 6am to 2pm  Her stall is beside toilet and she have walking difficulty with walking stick. Normally she will be working alone.  Just imagine , with her leg issue, she need to prepare food, cook food , serve customer all by herself.  Hope everyone will support her.  I never let her know that I will be posting this too. Just hoping I could help her Abit in her business too  Please help to share this post too.  Stay safe and fight against Covid-19.

properties.name: Moli Food Stall
properties.details: Bedok Snack Stall Barely Gets Customers, Auntie Still Wakes Up Early To Make & Sell Vadais. I was walking around and observing that many stalks are doing brisk business (probably due to a wet and rainy Saturday) until I spotted this lone stall - there was no one in queue. I observed that maybe one or 2 folks would walk up to the stall, take a look and walk off. I do not know why.  I decided to go up to the Aunty and strike up a conversation with her. Aunty is very soft spoken. She manage this stall on her own most times and sometimes with ad hoc help. She gets up early to prepare the ingredients. She / her stall is not on any delivery platform / FB.  She told me her business is so bad that she hardly makes any money. If not for the one month rental rebate from G, she hardly makes any money after deducting all the ingredients and supplies etc.  Her fear is understandable. So much so that she does not even dare to make more than 10 Vadai at a time for fear of them becoming too cold and hard which she is worried that it will make her lose her usual and maybe potential customers.  I bought a few Vadai back to try and I must say at $0.60cents a piece, they are good. Soft and flavourful. I choose to support her which I really think she genuinely needed more support in letting people know her existence.  As you are reading this, this is one such stall that you can seriously consider showing your support to her and by sharing this post. Not very expensive / difficult to begin with.  What is genuinely needed here is more support, more sharing and awareness for her. Life is already very tough for her at the current situation and its getting more harder each day as she wonders how long she can keep going and sustain it.

properties.name: Siraj Indian Rojak
properties.details: Was in the area today and visited Albert Food Centre this afternoon. Bought indian rojak from the popular Siraj Indian Rojak, whom I used to patronise some 15 years ago every Sunday. Uncle had a brief chat with me, saying that business has really been bad especially on Sundays when it’s usually the most busy for him. Some stalls along his row have closed on Sundays, as they’ve given up. Could sense his frustrations, and he also casually asked how I know about his store. He’s heard about hawkers being shared on social media etc, but doesn’t seem to have a clue on how that works. So just helping him out and posting a shout out here, especially since his Indian Rojak is nice. So do give it a try if you’re in Bugis area!!
